{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.19560v1", "title": "Strongly regular graphs in hyperbolic quadrics", "summary": "Let $Q^+(2n+1,q)$ be a hyperbolic quadric of $\rm PG(2n+1,q)$. Fix a
generator $\Pi$ of the quadric. Define $\mathcal{G}_n$ as the graph with vertex
set the points of $Q^+(2n+1,q)\setminus \Pi$ and two vertices adjacent if they
either span a secant to $Q^+(2n+1,q)$ or a line contained in $Q^+(2n+1,q)$
meeting $\Pi$ non-trivially. We show that $\mathcal{G}_n$ is a strongly regular
graph, that has, for $q=2$ the same parameters as the tangent graph
$NO^+(2n+2,2)$, but which is non-isomorphic for $n\geq3$. Hence for $n \geq 3$,
the graphs $\mathcal{G}_n$ are a putative new family of strongly regular
graphs.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-04-28T08:10:00Z"}
